creator: calestyo@scientia.net
text:
The SSLRequire option has the context "directory, .htaccess" named.

However, later the description says:
"Actually, in Global and Per-Server Class context expression is parsed at startup time and at runtime only the machine representation is executed. For Per-Directory context this is different: here expression has to be parsed and immediately executed for every request."

Can it also be used in vhosts/main server?

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Note also that .htaccess SSLRequire directives were not threadsafe for the
worker or event MPM's until version [insert version here].  We should probably
note this on the 2.0 and 2.2 versions of the docs

creator: humbedooh@apache.org
text:
I've looked through the C source just to be sure, and it does specifically say that it only works in the contexts already described. Perhaps the expression part refers to expressions in general and not the context in which SSLRequire is permitted?

Can someone confirm/elaborate/deb0rk this?

The context list is correct.

IMHO the distinction should be the static server config (where the expression is parsed only once) versus the .htaccess files (where it is parsed for every request). But this is how .htaccess files work in general, so the question is if that needs special mention. OTOH, parsing expressions may be a bit more expensive that parsing a simple config directive. So you may be right and the hint should be added to the general description of expressions.
creator: sf@sfritsch.de

text: I am closing this ticket as fixed, as it merited a small notice in the documentation, mentioning that the per-dir context refers to the use of .htaccess files. As Stefan says, this is the way .htaccess files work in general, and I agree that we shouldn't have to elaborate any further on the issue.
